framework_intro.para: 写此类文章时，建议采用以下结构。本结构强调不同点：首先列出所有相似点，然后列出所有不同点。将文章要点和内容填写到相应位置。

commentary.para: 比较和对比两种事物、观点、制度等的文章可有几种组织方式。
在本范例中，作者想强调两类学校之间的不同点。作者首先用一个段落讨论了相似点，然后分两段讨论两处重要差别，第三段讨论一些较次要的差别。
以下是本文所采用的结构。
构思文章时，须确定各段的内容并列出要点。
引言段的目的是说明文章主题（情况或问题等），以及打算如何展开讨论。典型的引言首先进行概括陈述，然后明确重点。
第 1、第 2 句引发读者的兴趣。
第 4 句指出文章的范围并引出下一段。
第 2 段指出 2 个相似点。
其余几段集中讨论差别。
结论段的目的是确定无疑地表明本人对该问题的看法。
第 1 句归纳总结文章的讨论结果。
第 2 句提出作者本人的看法。

checklist.point: 开动脑筋找出相似点和不同点。例如，将要点用表列出。
阅读这个主题的相关资料并展开调查研究。
突出显示相似点和不同点并决定哪方面更重要。
选择文章中哪些要点要包括在内、哪些要舍弃。
决定如何定义所比较的两个事物。
使用正式和客观的语言。
通过遣词造句描述差别。
通过遣词造句描述相似点。
使用衔接词和短语，以便读者对文章的结构一目了然。
介绍了主题、有逻辑地阐述主题并得出结论了吗？
结论与文章其他部分一致吗？
检查用词、语法、拼写和标点符号了吗？

content.para: Are private schools better than state schools?

paragraph.name: 引言
paragraph.desc: 引出主题并说明本文的讨论范围。

notes.para: Parents - have choice of state or private schools.
Definition: state schools = no fees; private schools = fees.
Important to look at differences - esp. curriculum, quality of teaching, achievement.

content.para: For parents, few things are more important than their child's education. In many countries, parents of school-age children can choose to send their child to a private school rather than to a state school. In this essay, state schools are defined as those that do not charge tuition fees because they are funded and run by local or central government; private schools, on the other hand, are funded almost entirely by the fees that they charge. Before deciding where to educate their child, parents need to examine the differences between the two types of school, particularly as regards the curriculum, the quality of tuition and student achievement.

paragraph.name: 相似点
paragraph.desc: 说明甲、乙之间相似的方面或特点。
paragraph.tip: 提示：此处可分几段讨论。

notes.para: Both have same aim: to increase knowledge, prepare for future.
Both have same organization: - terms/semesters and assessments.

content.para: Private and state schools are comparable in some respects. Like state schools, private schools aim to develop the knowledge, skills and character of students, in order to prepare them for their future lives. Both types of school are also very similar in the way they organize their teaching and assessment, using terms or semesters with assessments at the end of the academic year.

paragraph.name: 不同点
paragraph.desc: 接下来说明甲、乙之间不同的方面或特点。
paragraph.tip: 提示：此处可分几段讨论。

notes.para: Main differences: range of subjects - more in private schools. State schools have national curriculum.
: teachers - higher pay in private schools = more specialized teachers?
: class sizes - smaller in private schools = better discipline and higher standards.

content.para: Despite these similarities, there are a number of marked differences in the way that state and private schools operate. The range of subjects taught at state schools is largely limited by the demands of the national curriculum. In contrast, private schools can offer a greater choice of subjects, because they generally have more money to spend on equipment, technology and staff than state schools do.

Teachers working within the state system must have recognized teaching qualifications and are paid according to a national scale. Private schools, however, are in a position to offer higher salaries and may therefore be able to attract subject specialists who have considerable expertise in their field.

In general, it is true to say that while state schools have a high student-teacher ratio, private schools tend to offer smaller classes. This may lead to better discipline in private schools with the result that students may achieve somewhat higher academic standards.

paragraph.name: 结论
paragraph.desc: 根据所讨论的相似点和不同点的强弱程度进行归纳总结，说明自己的看法或得出结论。

notes.para: Differences are important - private schools may have advantages. Balance this against fees.

content.para: It is clear, therefore, that there are significant differences between private and state schools and that private schools may offer advantages. The benefits of private schooling must, however, be balanced against the cost involved and each family's budget priorities.
